# Bilawal Institute of Historical Research

| campus      = Urban
| affiliations= Government of Sindh
}}
The Bilawal Institute of Historical Research (BIHR) is a research and cultural institution located in Nawabshah (Shaheed Benazirabad), Sindh, Pakistan. It is known for preserving historical artifacts, maintaining a specialized library, and promoting cultural and academic activities in the region.
History and overview
Established in 1996, the institute operates under the Sindh provincial framework and is listed in official government organizational records. It has gained recognition for its museum, library, and open-air theatre facilities. The library contains over 2,200 books, including rare works, used by students, researchers, and scholars.
Facilities and activities
BIHR houses a museum with historical and cultural artifacts, an open-air theatre for public and academic events, and a research library. It regularly hosts cultural programs, seminars, and research gatherings.
Publications
The institute publishes the Bi-Annual Bilawal Research Journal, which features scholarly articles on history, culture, and heritage. One of its notable issues is Volume 3, Number 4 (2011), edited by Dr. Muhammad Laiq Zardari.
